geneSummary: EIF1AX, a translation initiation factor, is most frequently altered by mutation in uveal melanomas and papillary thyroid carcinomas.

mutationEffect.description: The EIF1AX G15D mutation is located in the N-terminal tail of the protein. This mutation has been identified in astrocytoma and is a statistically significant hotspot (PMID: 29263181). In vivo studies with yeast expressing EIF1AX G15D demonstrate that the mutation is inactivating as measured by decreased steady-state protein expression and recognition of the initiation site compared to wildtype (PMID: 29206102).

variantSummary: The EIF1AX G15D mutation is likely oncogenic.
